qas.question: When hydrogen is generated from natural gas, what des it produce?
How is hydrogen produced as a co product?

answers.text: Electrolysis of brine to yield chlorine

context: Hydrogen is sometimes produced and consumed in the same industrial process, without being separated. In the Haber process for the production of <a0_0>ammonia<a0_0/>, hydrogen is generated from natural gas. <a1_0>Electrolysis of brine to yield chlorine<a1_0/> also produces hydrogen as a co-product.
